attributes.action: Require UK Charities (like The Royal British Legion) to honour the expectations of our troops
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British and Allied troops are fighting - and dying - in the cause of (as the RBL stated in its Festival of Remembrance 2009) "Justice and Freedom for all."
    The petitioner cannot speak for all Service charities (having only been a member of the Royal British Legion), but asks the Prime Minister to remind Charities that complying with the rules of Natural Justice and Human Rights are 'not' an option, and that expelling members for trivial offences is an insult to our troops. Discipline and any Complaints Procedure should be reserved for those offences where the accused has been convicted by a court of his peers, and protection of the reputation of our troops requires their expulsion or punishment.
